ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Live virtual lecture and live discussion.
Online, reading, and speaking activities are done as homework outside of class.
There were no other means of learning.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I started learning Spanish and I realized that I really liked this language. I'm going to keep learning it.
Foundations of Spanish and being able to communicate at a basic level.
I learned the basic of Spanish and how to continue my growth in Spanish.
How to speak, read, and talk in Spanish.

I learned grammatical structures spanning the present, past, and basic future as well as a wide variety of vocabulary. In class, the majority of time was allocated to speaking/writing which I thought was very helpful.
I feel like I got a very good basic understanding of Spanish, especially writing and speaking in the present and past tenses.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Overall, I think that this course was done very well in keeping us surrounded in the material. This allowed me to grow in my Spanish knowledge.

Strengths: well taught and encouraging. The teacher was understanding about the difficulties of learning to speak a new language. 
Weaknesses: online formate made it more difficult to engage but the class did its best with what it had.

The weaknesses of this class is the speed with which the class moves through, while it is manageable to complete assignments and do well on quizzes and tests, I think it hurts students in the long run because some of the information doesnt stick as well as it would otherwise if more time was spent on each topic. The strengths of the class were definitely the speaking tests, I think preparing for those really improved my Spanish.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Overall, the practices were the best they could be given the online environment.

I really enjoyed Supersite activities and found them quite useful. Most things in general I felt like were basically the same as they would be in person. The only thing I didn't love about how they were formatted were the recordings.
Virtual learning in general seemed to be very successful for this class as we could meet at the assigned times and do the work when we were able to, even in different time zones.
The asynchronous days were helpful in stepping away from the virtual environment to learn on your own. Also the required keeping of cameras on was helpful to encourage more interaction.

I think the class succeeded as much as possible given the circumstances surrounding COVID, but I feel like something significant was lost with the Zoom classes as opposed to in-person seminar engagement.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, I would because it's both a language credit and also an engaging course.
Yes, even if you have some Spanish background I think this course solidifies it and provides you with a very good starting point for speaking, grammar, and reading.
If this person I am recommending want to learn Spanish, I would definitely recommend this course to them. It is a great introduction to Spanish.
Yes, I learned a lot of Spanish in a short amount of time.
Yes. If you are interested in learning Spanish at a relatively fast pace this class is a good introduction to the language.

I would recommend this class to any student who wants a background in Spanish. While the class wasnt especially difficult, it did require discipline to complete the daily online assignments which would take anywhere from 25mins to an hour per day depending on the difficulty of the work that particular day. In addition there is usually either a test, a speaking recording, or a partner project due once a week, with some weeks having combinations of the three. Planning ahead will make this very manageable but worth noting. Being genuinely interested in learning Spanish will make the class much more enjoyable and much easier.
